page.title: 19THE LOCAL HISTORY OF OFFLEY.
page.content: The elderly residents of Offley recall that as children they used to help their mothers with the straw plaiting. The straw plaiting was a cottage industry supplying the Luton factories with long plaits which were then made into the once famous straw boaters and bonnets. At the beginning of the century life in Offley was hard for the residents, most of whom earned their living on the land or as servants to the local gentry,they supplemented their small incomes by straw plaiting.Hitchin was the market town and the herdsmen would rise at 02.00 hours to drive their cattle to market.In Hitchin they recall the vile smell of the tannery the scent of the lavender shop and the sweet savour of malt from the brewery. They looked forward to walking into Hitchin and the Sunday School outing.
